title: Intuitive Machines planning up to three lunar lander missions in 2024
summary: As Intuitive Machines prepares for the launch of its first lunar lander mission, the company says it’s planning for up to three lander launches in 2024.

title: HyImpulse Inches Closer to Maiden SR75 Flight
summary:
German launch startup HyImpulse Technologies has announced the successful completion of the assembly and integration of its first SR75 launch vehicle. The HyImpulse SR75 is a one-stage suborbital rocket capable of carrying payloads of up to 250 kilograms to a maximum altitude of 200 kilometres. The vehicle is powered by the company’s HyPLOX-75 hybrid rocket […]
The post HyImpulse Inches Closer to Maiden SR75 Flight appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Morpheus unveils Journey software for mission planning
summary: Morpheus Space is releasing Journey, the space mobility company's first software program.

title: NASA “Pauses” Mars Sample Return Program While Assessing Options
summary: NASA officials told an advisory committee today they are pausing the Mars Sample Return program as they assess alternative architectures in the wake of increased costs and constrained budgets. A […]

title: Air Force warns programs will come to ‘screeching halt’ without budget deal
summary: Secretary of the Air Force Frank Kendall issued a stark warning Nov. 13 about the impact of funding delays and continuing threats of government shutdowns.

title: NASA slows down work on Mars Sample Return due to budget uncertainty
summary: NASA is slowing down work on Mars Sample Return (MSR) amid uncertainty about its budget for next year and an ongoing review of alternative architectures for the program.

title: SpaceX founding employee successfully moves from rockets to in-space propulsion
summary: "We want to make it cheap and easy to get anywhere in the Solar System."

title: First Dream Chaser Vehicle Ready for Final Testing
summary: After years of work, Sierra Space’s first Dream Chaser reusable spaceplane is almost ready to fly. The vehicle’s next step is a trip to NASA’s Neil A. Armstrong Test Facility in Ohio ahead of its first launch at the Kennedy Space Center currently scheduled for no earlier than March 2024.

title: From Kyiv to Taipei: Unraveling the impact of space on military power and Taiwan’s daunting prospects

title: SpaceNews 2023 Icon Awards honorees: Space Stewardship
summary: This year’s Space Stewardship honorees include two pioneers in the field of space situational awareness and an industry-led initiative to foster best practices in on-orbit satellite servicing and related endeavors, including active removal of orbital debris.
